meanings.definition: A situation in which further action or progress by opposing parties is impossible.
meanings.sent1: The chess game ended in a stalemate, with neither player able to make a move.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations reached a stalemate, and no agreement could be reached.
meanings.sent3: The two stubborn siblings reached a stalemate over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Their debate turned into a stalemate, each side unwilling to concede.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam was a frustrating stalemate, with cars at a complete standstill.

meanings.sent1: The protestors hoped to stalemate the construction project by blocking the entrance.
meanings.sent2: The strike threatened to stalemate the production line, causing delays.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his trick to stalemate the audience, leaving them in awe.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm seemed to stalemate the outdoor event, forcing everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected power outage managed to stalemate the entire operation, halting progress.
